ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Innoruuk stuff (was Race to 60)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehe, sorry.  Uber-guild means different things on different servers, but I basically meant that they were the first guild (by far) to be capable of doing
ygData.messageBody:
Hehe, sorry. "Uber-guild" means different things on different servers, but I basically meant that they
were the first guild (by far) to be capable of doing Planes and Dragons, and they are still stunningly
efficient at it. For awhile, other guilds would ask them to step back and give them a shot at Dragons,
they would give the guild 24 hours, then they'd step in and do it in 2. :) They're an extraordinarily
capable and well-organized guild. With that, in some cases, comes a touch of arrogance which is kind of
off-putting, but I don't think that it's anywhere near as bad on Innoruuk as on other servers, and of
course, it's still dependent on the individual. I didn't realize they were as small as they are; I'm even
more impressed now!

I forgot about some of the daytime and foreign guilds. They're big, too, now that I think about who I see
around when I'm on at 10am EST. Yesterday, I saw two Avenguardia members talking French. In Dark
Elvish. Now that will twist your head a little!

Kenross Cantoforjado, 49 songs, Innoruuk (who was asked the other day whose twink he was because he wasn't
level 50 yet. Aaaargh!)


Cheryl Kiraly wrote:

> LoD is considered the "uber-guild" of the server, for what that's worth.
>
> Again I plead ignorance... What do you mean by an "uber-guild"? That's a
> new one I have not seen before :)
